p: Teppo Eskelinen is senior lecturer in development studies at the University of Jyväskylä, Finland. His main research interests are alternative and community economies, heterodox economics, critical development theory and social movements. His recent publications include the co-edited book Enacting community economies within a welfare state (Mayflybooks, 2020), and articles in journals such as International journal of sociology and social policy, European countryside, and Nordic journal of social research.
